page.title: 01Cairnsmore of Fleet
page.content: Cairnsmore of Fleet, a hill rising 711 metres above sea level, situation: Galloway Hills east of Newton Stewart. Lower land area largely maintained by Forestry Commission specialising in planting of coniferous trees for commercial purposes. Conifers nursed for 2-3 years then planted on the hill growing on average 300cm per yr for 25-30 yrs. Land area at higher level used for hill sheep farming. Wild fauna and flora is varied and interesting above the trees deer found grazing on heather with grouse making full use of it as well. Fallow deer are plentiful on lower slopes. Hawks, particularly Sparrow Hawks are less evident it is reputed the reason for this is that their natural prey is being killed of by use of pesticides on trees & the hawks are being forced into unborn areas for food.
